_inspectorSnowReport.Report:
Wednesday February 18th 2026 | 5:35

Bonjour Tremblant!
Good morning skiers and snowboarders! It’s a chilly start out there today, so be sure to bundle up and dress warmly. The good news? The sun is expected to make an appearance later on, setting us up for a beautiful day on the slopes. We’re excited to share that 102 runs are open, meaning 100% of our terrain is ready and waiting for you to explore. Have an amazing day out there! 

First Tracks Access – This Wednesday
First Tracks will be available via the following lifts as early as 7:45 a.m:
  •  North Side: Expo Chair and Lowell Thomas Chair
  •  South Side: Télécabine
  • Ski on designated North Side slopes at 8a.m.
Operational Update-
https://blogue.tremblant.ca/operational-update-temporary-closure-north-side-feb-15-2026/

Have fun and stay safe! 

Mountain safety tip of the week:  Tips for a safe day on the slopes !
Complementing the Mountain Code of Conduct there’s 3 actions every skier and rider can take to help keep themselves and those around safer on the slopes.

1. Be Ready
Be ready to slow down or avoid objects or other people at any time. Ski and ride in a way that allows you to stay in control regardless of conditions and avoid others or obstacles on the run, groomed or otherwise.

2. Stay Alert
Stay aware of what’s happening around you, especially other skiers and riders. Paying attention to your surroundings and changing conditions helps ensure a fun and safe day on the hill.

3. Plan Ahead
Ease up at blind spots, check uphill when merging onto trails, and give other skiers plenty of room, especially when passing. Watch for spots where traffic merges or where you can’t see what’s coming next.

By doing these three things every run, you'll be helping keep the slopes safe and enjoyable, for you and everyone else.

 Snow fall is recorded daily at 5 a.m from mid-mountain at North Side (550 m / 1,800 ft). This data, based on 24 hours, provides a picture of on-mountain conditions. Actual accumulation may differ from the official report. Be aware of changing conditions. Lifts and trails exist in a mountain environment and may close due to weather, usage and/or special maintenance.

_inspectorSnowReport.SafetyReportFrench: Bonjour skieurs et planchistes! La journée commence avec des températures fraîches, alors n’oubliez pas de bien vous habiller. Bonne nouvelle : le soleil devrait se pointer un peu plus tard pour rendre la journée encore plus agréable sur les pentes. Nous sommes heureux d’annoncer que 102 pistes sont ouvertes, soit 100 % de notre domaine skiable à votre disposition. Excellente journée sur les pistes!
